target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from May 12, 2020 international travellers are required to produce medical certificates from countries of origin declaring them COVID-19 free and be subjected to 14-day quarantine upon arrival to South Sudan
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from January 26, 2020 the Sudanese Civil Aviation Authority passengers who originate from or transit through the UK, South Africa, and the Netherlands must possess a certified negative polymerise chain reaction test certificated dated within 72 hours of arrival.  These passengers are subject to a mandatory 14-day home quarantine.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of January 29, 2020 all incoming travellers to South Sudan must self-quarantine for 14 days.

description: From February 8, 2021 incoming travellers are still subject to 14 day self-isolation in South Sudan.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries

description: Starting from April 5, 2021 and until the end of the month, incoming international travellers arriving at Juba International Airport (JUB) require South Sudan's National Taskforce's permission before entering the country. Permitted travelers must present a negative COVID-19 test result from a screening taken within 96 hours before arriving in South Sudan. All incoming travelers are subject to a 14-day quarantine or self-isolation.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As of May 17, 2021 permitted travellers must present a negative result from a COVID-19 test taken within 96 hours before arriving in South Sudan. All incoming travelers are subject to a 14-day quarantine or self-isolation.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Starting from May 20, 2021 the Sudanese Civil Aviation Authority requires passengers who originate from or transit through the UK, South Africa, and the Netherlands to possess a certified negative polymerase chain (PCR) reaction test certificate dated within 72 hours of arrival.  These passengers are subject to a mandatory 14-day home quarantine.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On August 21, South Sudan's mosques have opened their doors to worshippers for the first time in five months as the government eased restrictions imposed to combat the coronavirus pandemic. Worshippers have been ordered to follow strict guidelines to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

description: Churches in Maridi County prepare to reopen after months of closure following the coronavirus pandemic. The Episcopal Church of South Sudan parishes will resume public worship services from Sunday 6th September 2020. Bishop Moses Zungo of the Episcopal Church of South Sudan Diocese of Maridi told Radio Tamazuj that the churches will observe the ministry of health guidelines and measures for the prevention of the spread of coronavirus.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
